metadata.synopsis: The githyanki have already departed on their red dragons. Lae’zel can join them or not if she’s present.Karlach leaves to die (in END_GameFinale_DeathOfKarlach). Towards the end of the dialogue, the party members wonder what to do next.JLatino: I believe Orpheus cannot appear in this sequence, he will always have departed. Looks like this can mostly take place on the pier.EXITS:END_BrainBattle_CombatOver_Nested_WhatNextEND_BrainBattle_CombatOver_Nested_ConclusionTerminus
metadata.how_to_trigger: Dear cinematics team - we are really sorry for all the hardship we caused you but we wanted you to know we love you dearly and appreciate tremendously the way you bring our words to life. With love,The writing team

56.speaker: Player
56.text: *With your people gone, there's nothing left but the silence of the city, smouldering, waiting to be rebuilt.*
56.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player turns from the skies back to the bay. They walk out to the docks to watch the dying rays of the sun ripple across the water.

We could start similar to the Dragon's Arrive Stage from END_BrainBattle_CombatOver, but it's probably simpler to cut to a neutral shot and walk down to the docks.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: *With your people gone, there's nothing left but the silence of the city, smouldering, waiting to be rebuilt.*
71.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player turns from the skies back to the bay. They walk out to the docks to watch the dying rays of the sun ripple across the water.

We could start similar to the Dragon's Arrive Stage from END_BrainBattle_CombatOver, but it's probably simpler to cut to a neutral shot and walk down to the docks.

101.text: *With your people gone, there's nothing left but the silence of the city, smouldering, waiting to be rebuilt.*
101.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player turns from the skies back to the bay. They walk out to the docks to watch the dying rays of the sun ripple across the water.

We could start similar to the Dragon's Arrive Stage from END_BrainBattle_CombatOver, but it's probably simpler to cut to a neutral shot and walk down to the docks.

172.speaker: Narrator
172.text: *With the githyanki gone, there's nothing left but the silence of the city, smouldering, waiting to be rebuilt.*
172.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player turns from the skies back to the bay. They walk out to the docks to watch the dying rays of the sun ripple across the water.

We could start similar to the Dragon's Arrive Stage from END_BrainBattle_CombatOver, but it's probably simpler to cut to a neutral shot and walk down to the docks.

357.text: *The Crown is in the depths of the Chionthar, waiting for your summons. You have the means to reforge it, and revive the power of Netheril anew.*
357.context: NodeContext: Speaking of Gale, a mind flayer, who knows that he could reforge the Crown of Karsus - the very thing that allowed the Netherbrain to be dominated and become the Netherbrain

372.speaker: Narrator
372.text: *The Crown is in the depths of the Chionthar, waiting for your summons. You have the means to reforge it, and revive the power of Netheril anew.*
372.context: NodeContext: Speaking of Gale, a mind flayer, who knows that he could reforge the Crown of Karsus - the very thing that allowed the Netherbrain to be dominated and become the Netherbrain

252.speaker: Narrator
252.text: *The Karsite Weave palpates within you - stirred by the very prospect.*
252.context: NodeContext: the power within Gale resonating at the prospect of more power

220.speaker: Narrator
220.text: *The Crown is in the depths of the Chionthar, waiting for your summons. You could reforge it, and revive the power of Netheril.*
220.context: NodeContext: Speaking of Gale, who knows that he could reforge the Crown of Karsus - the very thing that allowed the Netherbrain to be dominated and become the Netherbrain

316.speaker: Narrator
316.text: *The Crown is in the depths of the Chionthar. You will salvage the stones and reforge the Crown, the power of Netheril in your hands at last.*
316.context: NodeContext: Speaking of Gale, who knows that he could reforge the Crown of Karsus - the very thing that allowed the Netherbrain to be dominated and become the Netherbrain

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *The Karsite Weave palpates within you - stirred by the very prospect.*
10.context: NodeContext: the power within Gale resonating at the prospect of more power

152.speaker: Narrator
152.text: *Once the Crown is restored, you could return it to Mystra, fulfilling her wishes, and ridding the mortal world of such temptation.
152.context: NodeContext: Gale is speculating one path he could take (the morally good one)

257.speaker: Narrator
257.text: *Or... you could take control of it for yourself, and become a god.*
257.context: NodeContext: Speculating on the other path Gale could take (the ambitious one) - becoming a god and having absolute power

213.speaker: Narrator
213.text: *Your allies' journeys may have ended with the Netherbrain's death, but yours has not.*
213.context: NodeContext: The moment before Gale speaks to his god, Mystra

209.speaker: Narrator
209.text: *One way or another, you will have to reckon with your god. It's time to speak to Mystra.*
209.context: NodeContext: The moment before Gale speaks to his god, Mystra

136.speaker: Narrator
136.text: *The Crown is in the depths of the Chionthar. If you salvage the stones, you could claim it, reforge it, and revive the power of Netheril anew.*
136.context: InternalNodeContext: KNOWS ABOUT REFORGING CROWNNodeContext: Speaking of Gale, who knows that he could reforge the Crown of Karsus - the very thing that allowed the Netherbrain to be dominated and become the Netherbrain

64.speaker: Narrator
64.text: *Mystra's summons still stands. Bring the Crown to her and she may yet offer you a cure, but there is no guarantee that she will be in a forgiving mood.*
64.context: InternalNodeContext: Knows Mystra wants to speak to youNodeContext: Gale weighing internally pros and cons of doing what Mystra says

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *Already you feel the orb straining against the confines of Elminster's spell. It will not hold forever. How will you spend the time that you have left?*
84.context: CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: would be nice to show the companions walking up behind the player here, but that's a lot of work.InternalNodeContext: LOGIC: HAS COMPANIONS

169.speaker: Narrator
169.context: CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: would be nice to show the companions walking up behind the player here, but that's a lot of work.InternalNodeContext: LOGIC: HAS COMPANIONS

319.speaker: Astarion
319.text: I suggest we take a moment to rest, recuperate, and drink the nectars of victory.
319.context: NodeContext: While Gale seems to be moping, ready to move on from the scene of battle to a pub

79.speaker: Lae'zel
79.text: I suggest we take a moment to rest, recuperate, and drink the nectars of victory.
79.context: NodeContext: While Gale seems to be moping, ready to move on from the scene of battle to a pub

83.speaker: Lae'zel
83.text: And you, Gale? What are your next steps?
83.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

237.text: I will not be joining you. I've a Crown to reforge, and perhaps - a chance to become a god.
237.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

191.speaker: Player
191.text: I will not be joining you. I've a Crown to reforge, and perhaps - a chance to become a god.
191.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

116.speaker: Lae'zel
116.text: Wield a god's power, and expect the full weight of opposing gods' wrath. I expect Mystra will be the first you contend with.
116.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

371.speaker: Narrator
371.text: *The very air around you thrums with anticipation, and fear. Can you really handle such power, such authority?*
371.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale contemplating his newfound power, feeling his isolation from his surroundings and his partyNodeContext: speaking of Gale, who is fairly sure he's about to become a god

128.speaker: Narrator
128.text: *Whyever not? After all, you are an illithid - whatever flaws plagued you as a human are long behind you now.*
128.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale in Illithid form, flexing his Illithid magic, interwoven with Karsite magicInternalNodeContext: ILLITHID

227.speaker: Narrator
227.text: *Your allies seek to celebrate, but they know not what is to come. Yours will be a different future - a glorious one, and you will walk it alone.*
227.context:
CinematicNodeContext: As Gale is empowered, he vanishes.

The camera zooms out of the party confused by where he has disappeared to.

The final image settles on the Sun in the evening sky, with VFX taking on the shape of Gale's tattoo, underscoring his godlike powersInternalNodeContext: HAS COMPANIONS

177.speaker: Narrator
177.context: InternalNodeContext: LOGIC: END NODE SOLO GALE AV

162.speaker: Narrator
162.text: *There's only one way to find out.*
162.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale, determined, the course is set

268.speaker: Shadowheart
268.text: Ambitious - don't let Mystra hear you say that.
268.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

107.speaker: Wyll
107.text: An ambitious enterprise. One I doubt Mystra will stand for.
107.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

95.speaker: Halsin
95.text: Such ambition - you make me look positively humble.
95.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Gale has expressed his desire to be a god.

292.speaker: Astarion
292.text: Such ambition - you make me look positively humble.
292.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Gale has expressed his desire to be a god.

17.speaker: Astarion
17.text: I can't fault your ambition. I don't know if I'd pick a fight with Mystra myself, but more power to you.
17.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

214.speaker: Minsc
214.text: Minsc and Boo wish you well, my friend - but think this is perhaps the way into Mystra's bad books, not back into her heart.
214.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

111.speaker: Halsin
111.text: A lofty goal. Be careful of Mystra - she shall not care to have a new rival.
111.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

377.speaker: Jaheira
377.text: A humble task ahead, then. And one in which your Mystra will no doubt wish you well.
377.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly. Jaheira's line mildly sarcastic - 'oh, is that all'

190.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
190.text: I wish you well. And if Mystra stands in your way, call on me, wizard. I have acquired a taste for killing gods.
190.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, and Minthara relishes the opportunity to fight Mystra by his side. The 'god' she is talking about killing is Mystra rather than Gale.

282.speaker: Karlach
282.text: If anyone can, it's you, Gale. Whether you should is a question you might consider, though.
282.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

123.speaker: Player
123.text: It's time I leave you. I must reforge the Crown. If I offer it to Mystra, perhaps she'll cure me of the orb.
123.context: NodeContext: sympathetic (in her own way) to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

272.speaker: Lae'zel
272.text: Only a cruel god would refuse you. May Mystra's wisdom prevail over her enmity.
272.context: NodeContext: sympathetic (in her own way) to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

254.speaker: Narrator
254.text: *Perhaps Mystra will recognise you for your humility, perhaps not.*
254.context: NodeContext: morally good outcome for Gale who made sacrifices

219.speaker: Narrator
219.text: *Of one thing you may be assured - the world will be safe from the Crown's power, thanks to you - the illithid that defeated a Netherbrain.*
219.context: NodeContext: morally good outcome for Gale who made sacrifices

174.speaker: Narrator
174.text: *Of one thing you may be assured - the world will be safe from the Crown's power, thanks to you - Gale of Waterdeep, the wizard who defeated a Netherbrain.*
174.context: NodeContext: morally good outcome for Gale

133.speaker: Shadowheart
133.text: Perhaps. I can't speak to the qualities of Mystra, but I can certainly speak to those of her servant.
133.context: NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest. 'I'm no longer one' = SH has abandoned Shar. 'Perhaps...' = SH is loyal to Shar

215.speaker: Astarion
215.text: A little demeaning to go running to your god after everything we've achieved, but if that's what it takes to survive...
215.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

147.speaker: Astarion
147.text: A little demeaning to go running to your god after everything we've achieved, but if that's what it takes to survive...
147.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

160.speaker: Minsc
160.text: Minsc thinks she is owing you this much, at least. We look forward to your return - healed and pure of chest!
160.context: NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

347.speaker: Astarion
347.text: Of course, your other condition. But if anything can convince your god to do what's right, the Crown can.
347.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

277.speaker: Wyll
277.text: I'm sure it will come to pass. Find me when it's done - I'll want to hear your story.
277.context: NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

68.speaker: Halsin
68.text: Of course she will. The world has no need for a goddess who would hesitate at such a request from her champion. I hope to see you again, Gale.
68.context: NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

360.speaker: Jaheira
360.text: A grand enough gesture to win back her good graces, I think. I wish you luck, wizard.
360.context: NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

51.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
51.text: You are a wise enough man to know that one should not expect kindness from the gods, Gale.
51.context: NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

49.speaker: Karlach
49.text: I hope she does. And we see each other again soon, both less explosive than ever before.
49.context: NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

322.speaker: Player
322.text: You go on ahead. I miss Waterdeep, and I'd like to go home.

311.speaker: Player
311.text: A celebration sounds ideal. Whatever time I have left, I'd like to spend it with you.

18.speaker: Shadowheart
18.text: But what about you, Gale? What will you do now...?
18.context: NodeContext: Uncertain (Gale is a mind flayer in this case, having transformed to save the day)

344.speaker: Astarion
344.text: Although it seems not everyone is in the mood to celebrate. What's happening in that head of yours, Gale?
344.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] being sensitive to Gale's somewhat thougthful mood

102.speaker: Wyll
102.text: Gale - what about you? Where do you go from here?
102.context: NodeContext: Uncertain (Gale is a mind flayer in this case, having transformed to save the day)

346.speaker: Halsin
346.text: But what awaits you, Gale? Your path ahead is... unclear.
346.context: NodeContext: Uncertain (Gale is a mind flayer in this case, having transformed to save the day)

313.speaker: Minsc
313.text: Now, Gale, you're looking decidedly 'thinky'. I hope you're not about to spoil this excellent, excellent plan.
313.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Gale seems to be moping

97.speaker: Astarion
97.text: Now, Gale, you're looking decidedly 'thinky'. I hope you're not about to spoil this excellent, excellent plan.
97.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Gale seems to be moping

5.speaker: Jaheira
5.text: Though, first - Gale. What is it you plan to do next?
5.context: NodeContext: Catching herself as the party was just about to decide on a celebration - Gale's a mind flayer, and shouldn't be forgotten.

312.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
312.text: You seem distracted, wizard. I can no longer spy your thoughts - so speak them.

330.speaker: Minsc
330.text: Though first - what of you, wizard?

260.speaker: Shadowheart
260.text: I think a celebration is in order. It's the least we deserve.
260.context: NodeContext: Like clearing her throat so as to move the party on from scene of battle towards more joyous things

221.speaker: Astarion
221.text: Well, that's enough world-saving for one day. If any other existential threats appear, someone else can handle it - we are finding a tavern and celebrating.
221.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] While Gale seems to be moping, trying to move the party on  from the scene of battle to a pub

182.speaker: Wyll
182.text: A suggestion, if I may: a celebration. I know I could use a few sips of good ale.
182.context: NodeContext: While Gale seems to be moping, ready to move on from the scene of battle to a pub

318.speaker: Halsin
318.text: Perhaps it's time for a celebration. We have earned it.
318.context: NodeContext: While Gale seems to be moping, ready to move on from the scene of battle to a pub

308.speaker: Jaheira
308.text: Would anyone else like to sit down? Lie down? Drink until we fall down, perhaps?
308.context: NodeContext: Breaking a moment of high tension / catharsis with a genuinely exhausted sigh.

341.speaker: Minsc
341.text: No one else wishes to say it? Very well, then. DRINKING!
341.context: NodeContext: Looking around, clearing throat before 'DRINKING!'

378.speaker: Karlach
378.text: I think we've earned a celebration. Don't you?
378.context: NodeContext: While Gale seems to be moping, trying to move the party on  from the scene of battle to a pub

55.speaker: Astarion
55.text: Well, if that's everything - and I sincerely hope it is - we should find a tavern and celebrate. We've certainly earned it.
55.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] While Gale seems to be moping, ready to move on from the scene of battle to a pub

163.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
163.text: That we have survived is a miracle. I propose we celebrate with whatever filth passes as wine in this city.
163.context: NodeContext: While Gale seems to be moping, trying to move the party on  from the scene of battle to a pub

35.speaker: Player
35.text: It's time the Crown had a new owner - you. The illithid that defeated the Netherbrain.

276.speaker: Player
276.text: It's time the Crown had a new owner - you. The wizard that defeated the Netherbrain.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Reforge the Crown. Offer it to Mystra, hope that it's enough for her to cure you of the orb.

264.speaker: Narrator
264.text: *You could take the Crown to Mystra, perhaps leverage it for a cure. But there is no guarantee that she will be in a forgiving mood.*
264.context: NodeContext: Gale weighing internally pros and cons of interacting with Mystra at this critical juncture

380.speaker: Narrator
380.text: *You felt the magic of Karsus draining from the stones as the Crown plummeted to the bottom of the Chionthar. A useless trinket, nothing more.*
380.context: CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: If you can fake a reflection by flipping the player upsidedown under the water, this would be a good place to do it.

166.speaker: Narrator
166.text: *At least the mortal world will be safe from the temptation of the Crown. But you...*
166.context: CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: If you can fake a reflection by flipping the player upsidedown under the water, this would be a good place to do it.

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *You are a mind flayer, the very thing you sought to eradicate. Whatever self you still possess is quickly ebbing away.*
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: If you can fake a reflection by flipping the player upsidedown under the water, this would be a good place to do it.

154.speaker: Narrator
154.text: *Your friends and enemies alike are ripe for manipulation, and if not manipulation, then consumption.*
154.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale joins the player in their introspective view of the bay.

131.speaker: Narrator
131.text: *Soon you will not be able to trust yourself at all. You will be a monstrosity beyond redemption.*
131.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale joins the player in their introspective view of the bay.

129.speaker: Narrator
129.text: *Or not. Perhaps you are unique among illithid-kind. Perhaps you will retain enough of who you are to resist your nature.*
129.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale joins the player in their introspective view of the bay.

337.speaker: Narrator
337.text: *A rogue mind flayer. Like the Emperor.*
337.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale joins the player in their introspective view of the bay.

267.speaker: Narrator
267.text: *The risk is certainly yours to take - will you?*
267.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale joins the player in their introspective view of the bay.

351.speaker: Player
351.text: You finally have a chance to live. Embrace it.
351.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale joins the player in their introspective view of the bay.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: You are a mind flayer now. You have never been so wise, nor strong, nor cool. Embrace it.
132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale joins the player in their introspective view of the bay.

297.speaker: Narrator
297.text: *Your fate will be what you make of it. Now, you are your own master.*
297.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale joins the player in their introspective view of the bay.

24.speaker: Narrator
24.text: *But it seems that Gale's mind is elsewhere.*
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale joins the player in their introspective view of the bay.

143.speaker: Shadowheart
143.text: Gale - this is no time for sentimental gawking.
143.context: NodeContext: slightly impatent - Gale clearly has something on his mind

370.speaker: Lae'zel
370.text: Gale - this is no time for sentimental gawking.
370.context: NodeContext: slightly impatent - Gale clearly has something on his mind

301.speaker: Lae'zel
301.text: Speak your troubles - or relinquish them.
301.context: NodeContext: slightly impatent - Gale clearly has something on his mind

226.speaker: Gale
226.text: The Crown - it's somewhere in the Chionthar.
226.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is standing to one side, looking out toward the Chionthar. NodeContext: thoughtful

89.speaker: Gale
89.text: If I salvage the stones, I can reforge it.
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale turns back to face party.NodeContext: subtly excited

238.speaker: Gale
238.text: And once I have, I'll return it to Mystra.
238.context: NodeContext: sure of himself - this is the right thing to do

113.speaker: Gale
113.text: With the Crown in my hands, I would be unstoppable. The Karsite Weave would be mine to command.
113.context: NodeContext: excited by the prospect of power

53.speaker: Gale
53.text: I would be more than the greatest wizard who ever lived - I would be a god.
53.context: NodeContext: emotions rising at the prospect of GODHOOD

46.speaker: Player
46.text: You'll make a fine god, but I can't go with you. I'm sorry.

366.text: I understand. You are right to heed such doubts, however much sadness it brings me to leave you behind.

247.speaker: Gale
247.text: I understand. You are right to heed such doubts, however much sadness it brings me to leave you behind.

339.speaker: Player
339.text: Is that really what you want, Gale?

40.text: Want, need, deserve... Choose whatever word you prefer, but it is what I'm going to do.

148.speaker: Gale
148.text: Want, need, deserve... Choose whatever word you prefer, but it is what I'm going to do.

338.speaker: Gale
338.text: Mystra has dictated the terms of my potential for long enough. The Crown would grant me control of my own destiny at last.

158.speaker: Gale
158.text: Think of all I could achieve, all that I could grant to those whose ambitions are restrained by Mystra's yoke. I could raise a new Netheril right here in Faerûn.
158.context: NodeContext: attempting to rationalise his desire for power, losing himself in this vision of greatness

329.speaker: Player
329.text: Good luck, Gale. Don't forget me when you're a god.

300.speaker: Player
300.text: Good luck, Gale. Don't forget me when you're a god.

241.speaker: Gale
241.text: It's I who should be saying such things. Do not think I leave you without a heart as heavy as your own. But I owe it to myself to follow where destiny leads.

303.speaker: Gale
303.text: I will never forget you - that I promise. And if you ever feel differently, there will be a place waiting for you in the heavens.
303.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale leavesNodeContext: with affection towards a loved one

355.speaker: Player
355.text: We will be gods together, Gale. I will be right by your side.
355.context: NodeContext: the crown is what's at the front of his mind

210.speaker: Gale
210.text: That day cannot come soon enough. But first, I must retrieve the Crown.
210.context: NodeContext: the crown is what's at the front of his mind

175.speaker: Gale
175.text: Have patience a while and I will return to you, carrying immortality in one hand and offering you ascension with the other. I will be a god, as will you.
175.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale leavesNodeContext: confidence bordering on intimidating

343.speaker: Player
343.text: Your hubris was your downfall once, Gale. I thought you were wiser than to make the same mistake again.

4.speaker: Gale
4.text: And I thought you wise enough to recognise that I am not the man I once was.

161.speaker: Gale
161.text: It seems that we've come to an impasse. I stand on the threshold of divine ascension, and you would try to keep me grounded.
161.context: NodeContext: confident - he's the one in control here

115.speaker: Gale
115.text: It's not your fault - I can hardly expect you to understand. But nor will I relinquish the chance of godhood for a love that would only last a mortal lifetime. I'm sorry.
115.context: NodeContext: like talking to a child who's too young to know about these things, but with genuine sadness when he speaks of being sad to leave you

12.speaker: Gale
12.text: It's not your fault - I can hardly expect you to understand. But nor will I relinquish this chance because you are unwilling to imagine a world where I succeed.
12.context: NodeContext: like talking to a child who's too young to know about these things, but with genuine sadness when he speaks of being sad to leave you

77.speaker: Gale
77.text: I will never forget you - that much I promise. And if one day you feel differently, I would be honoured to have you as my Chosen.
77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale leavesNodeContext: A little pompous, likes the idea of this shifted dynamic between you. Meant sincerely though.

373.text: Gale will be but one god among many - doomed to squabble, to battle, to vie for control and power. And we will be the pieces they play with.
373.context: NodeContext: with concern - Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

251.speaker: Player
251.text: Gale will be but one god among many - doomed to squabble, to battle, to vie for control and power. And we will be the pieces they play with.
251.context: NodeContext: with concern - Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Gale will be but one god among many - doomed to squabble, to battle, to vie for control and power. And we will be the pieces they play with.
32.context: NodeContext: with concern - Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

369.speaker: Lae'zel
369.text: Gale will be but one god among many - doomed to squabble, to battle, to vie for control and power. And we will be the pieces they play with.
369.context: NodeContext: with concern - Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

314.speaker: Lae'zel
314.text: But somehow I do not think Mystra will allow it to happen so readily.
314.context: NodeContext: but not that much concern

225.speaker: Lae'zel
225.text: He chose his fate. Now, let us make the most of ours.
225.context: NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

149.speaker: Astarion
149.text: So, what next? Something fun, I hope?

180.speaker: Astarion
180.text: So, what's next for us? The world is our oyster, and she has many pearls we can choose from.
180.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Asking the player what's next

159.speaker: Wyll
159.text: So - what now? I don't know about you, but I could use a flagon or three of ale.
159.context: NodeContext: After a moment of leavetaking / catharsis after winning our final battle. Sighing, drawing herself up for the next task despite her exhaustion

381.speaker: Halsin
381.text: What comes now? I cannot remember the last time we did not have a grand purpose to work towards...
381.context: NodeContext: After a moment of leavetaking / catharsis after winning our final battle. Sighing, drawing herself up for the next task despite her exhaustion

7.speaker: Jaheira
7.text: Right. I suppose there is more work to do, now. What first?
7.context: NodeContext: After a moment of leavetaking / catharsis after winning our final battle. Sighing, drawing herself up for the next task despite her exhaustion

349.speaker: Minsc
349.text: Well and good, but enough of that. What now? My hamster is hungry.

197.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
197.text: What shall we do with our liberty?

50.speaker: Gale
50.text: So, what comes now? A bath certainly wouldn't go amiss...

179.speaker: Shadowheart
179.text: Farewell, Gale. I hope he still remembers us little people, once he's secured godhood.
179.context: NodeContext: Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

141.speaker: Shadowheart
141.text: Though he may have to contend with Mystra before that's a foregone conclusion.
141.context: NodeContext: doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become one

37.speaker: Shadowheart
37.text: As for us, well... the future awaits.
37.context: NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

153.speaker: Astarion
153.text: I swear, you ascend to unprecedented power one time and then suddenly everyone's doing it...
153.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

48.speaker: Astarion
48.text: I do wonder how he'll fare when Mystra decides to crush him. It could be quite the show.
48.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become a god

90.speaker: Astarion
90.text: But enough about the wizard. Let's talk about us.
90.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] more interested in what's happening in the here and now

23.speaker: Astarion
23.text: I've never been on first-name terms with a god before. It could have its perks.
23.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

81.speaker: Astarion
81.text: I can't imagine Mystra will take it... lying down? Floating? However gods relax.
81.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become a god

229.speaker: Astarion
229.text: Still, good luck to him. I'm sure he'll go far.
229.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] more interested in what's happening in the here and now

286.speaker: Wyll
286.text: Once Gale tasted of godhood, he was always bound to fill himself full. May he be wiser than he is cocksure, for his own sake.
286.context: NodeContext: Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

203.speaker: Wyll
203.text: After all, Mystra's not about to welcome him to the pantheon with open arms.
203.context: NodeContext: doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become one

94.speaker: Wyll
94.text: For now, though - let us leave Gale to his future, and turn to our own.
94.context: NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

34.speaker: Halsin
34.text: I shall miss him. Though I hope he proves to be a kindly god - I have had my fill of the tyrannical sort.
34.context: NodeContext: Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

358.speaker: Halsin
358.text: Though I hope he has the mettle needed to face Mystra. She will not yield willingly, I fear...
358.context: NodeContext: doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become one

348.speaker: Halsin
348.text: A new chapter awaits - let us make haste.
348.context: NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

309.speaker: Jaheira
309.text: Another low mortal, grasping at godhood. Perhaps he will manage it, and be everything he promises - perhaps not.
309.context: NodeContext: Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

74.speaker: Jaheira
74.text: Better for the world not to find out at all, I think. And certainly better for Gale that Mystra does not.
74.context: NodeContext: doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become one

294.speaker: Jaheira
294.text: But he's set himself on his path. We have our own next steps to think on.
294.context: NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

106.speaker: Minsc
106.text: And all to impress a former lover. Gale should do as Minsc did, and stop at the face tattoo.
106.context: NodeContext: Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

69.speaker: Minsc
69.text: Mystra no longer wishes to share his bed. Boo doubts she will wish to share the mastery of all magic with him instead.
69.context: NodeContext: doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become one

270.speaker: Minsc
270.text: But, let the wizard wet his robes in the river, if that is his wish.
270.context: NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

280.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
280.text: I envy him. If we had dominated the brain, we would be greater than gods.
280.context: NodeContext: Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

63.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
63.text: Perhaps one day the planes will quake as Mystra and Gale clash for control of the Weave. I would not bet against our wizard if it does come to pass.
63.context: NodeContext: thoughtful - anticipating the prospect with some excitement

58.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
58.text: As it is, our future is uncertain, and we must face it without divinity, without our illithid powers, as mortals.
58.context: NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

354.speaker: Player
354.text: Don't do it, Gale. Stay here, with me.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Such power was not meant for mortals, Gale. You should give it to Mystra like she asked.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: Such power was not meant for mortals, Gale. You should give the Crown to Mystra.

289.speaker: Gale
289.text: The power of Karsus would be in my hands...

283.speaker: Gale
283.text: But what then? What would I do with it, once I have it?
283.context: NodeContext: contemplation drawing a mental blank

291.speaker: Player
291.text: Such power was not meant for mortals. Retrieve the Crown, and give it to Mystra, as she asked.
291.context: NodeContext: his resolve is beginning to form

208.text: Sage and timely counsel, as always. And I intend to heed it.
208.context: NodeContext: his resolve is beginning to form

235.speaker: Gale
235.text: Sage and timely counsel, as always. And I intend to heed it.
235.context: NodeContext: his resolve is beginning to form

157.text: A wise man learns from his mistakes, and strives not to repeat them. I shall bring the Crown to Mystra.

31.speaker: Gale
31.text: A wise man learns from his mistakes, and strives not to repeat them. I shall bring the Crown to Mystra.

284.speaker: Gale
284.text: She'll cure me of my affliction, and I'll finally be free.
284.context: NodeContext: sure of himself - this is the right thing to do

99.text: Better yet, you'll be her Chosen again.
99.context: NodeContext: he'd genuinely forgotten about that and is just now remembering

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Better yet, you'll be her Chosen again.
85.context: NodeContext: he'd genuinely forgotten about that and is just now remembering

176.speaker: Gale
176.text: And a more deserving one this time around.
176.context: NodeContext: he'd genuinely forgotten about that and is just now remembering

320.speaker: Player
320.text: Perhaps, or she might just reject you again.

310.speaker: Gale
310.text: Regardless, it's the right thing to do. That's good enough for me.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Why do you care what Mystra thinks? Keep the Crown and you could be a god.

266.speaker: Gale
266.text: Ugh, no. Having seen what we've seen of those who chase godhood, I'm quite content with my mortality.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: You promised me that we would be gods together, Gale.

155.speaker: Gale
155.text: I promise, you'll have your fill of divinity at my hands. And I at yours, I hope. But only in the metaphorical sense.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: Are you sure you're ready to give up such powers? You'll never have the chance again.

212.speaker: Gale
212.text: If this adventure has taught me anything, it's that there are things in this world far more valuable than power.

230.speaker: Gale
230.text: You, for example. You were always wiser than me when it mattered most.
230.context: NodeContext: speaking to a loved one with great affection

364.speaker: Gale
364.text: Besides, I've grown quite fond of this merry band of ours, and I'd quite like to see what happens to it.
364.context: NodeContext: tonal shift towards levity the way British people do as soon as they've had an emotion

323.text: I'm sure Mystra will summon me soon enough, but until then, I propose we celebrate our victory the mortal way - with a drink in our hands, and reckless abandon in our hearts.

88.speaker: Gale
88.text: I'm sure Mystra will summon me soon enough, but until then, I propose we celebrate our victory the mortal way - with a drink in our hands, and reckless abandon in our hearts.

122.speaker: Narrator
122.text: Revelry? A grand notion - we've earned the right to an indulgence or two.
122.context: NodeContext: surprised to hear Gale say it, but very much on board

340.speaker: Shadowheart
340.text: Revelry? A grand notion - we've earned the right to an indulgence or two.
340.context: NodeContext: surprised to hear Gale say it, but very much on board

326.speaker: Lae'zel
326.text: Revelry? A grand notion - we've earned the right to an indulgence or two.
326.context: NodeContext: surprised to hear Gale say it, but very much on board

173.speaker: Lae'zel
173.text: But I leave the final call to our esteemed leader.

261.speaker: Astarion
261.text: I'm not sure about 'drink in hand', but I think we've all earned some reckless abandon.
261.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Eager (game over, time to go celebrate)

28.speaker: Astarion
28.text: How about you? Any thoughts on what's next?

332.speaker: Astarion
332.text: I should probably skip the meal and nightcap, but by the gods, it would be good to rest.
332.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] The game's over, time to go celebrate. Gale's suggested a nice meal and a nightcap.

45.speaker: Minsc
45.text: Boo wins the bet. Wizards are not entirely boring.

327.speaker: Minsc
327.text: Well, my friend? What do you say?

302.speaker: Shadowheart
302.text: Now you're talking. After all that, I think I'll need a drink in each hand, and a third on the table.
302.context: NodeContext: Eager (game over, time to go celebrate)

62.speaker: Shadowheart
62.text: But I think right of choosing should fall to you. What'll it be?

100.speaker: Astarion
100.text: I'll see your 'reckless abandon' and raise you 'unrestrained hedonism'.
100.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Eager (game over, time to go celebrate)

178.text: What do you say? Because I think we've earned it.

156.speaker: Astarion
156.text: What do you say? Because I think we've earned it.

325.speaker: Astarion
325.text: We can do better than a nightcap, surely? A little hedonism, perhaps? Just a touch of debauchery?
325.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] The game's over, time to go celebrate. Gale's suggested a nice meal and a nightcap.

352.speaker: Wyll
352.text: A nip, a dance, and a song? Don't mind if I do - I think we're due an evening's reprieve.
352.context: NodeContext: Eager (game over, time to go celebrate)

52.speaker: Wyll
52.text: What's our leader have to say?

15.speaker: Halsin
15.text: I am seldom one to imbibe, but even I shall make an exception on a day like today.
15.context: NodeContext: Eager (game over, time to go celebrate)

125.speaker: Halsin
125.text: I think we have earned it, no?

288.speaker: Jaheira
288.text: That might be the smartest thing you've ever said, Gale.

324.text: What do you think? Time for a quick one, before the work begins again?

248.speaker: Jaheira
248.text: What do you think? Time for a quick one, before the work begins again?

181.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
181.text: That's the wisest idea the wizard's had yet.

117.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
117.text: What say you? I think we deserve a drink to celebrate surviving that horror.

112.speaker: Gale
112.text: I'm sure a summons from Mystra will appear soon enough, but until then, I propose we celebrate our victory as mortals do best - with a drink in our hands, and reckless abandon in our hearts.

228.speaker: Player
228.text: Such power was not meant for mortals, Gale. Perhaps you should give the Crown to Mystra.

189.text: Perhaps with this offering, she'll finally cure me of the affliction of the orb.

198.speaker: Gale
198.text: Perhaps with this offering, she'll finally cure me of the affliction of the orb.

41.speaker: Player
41.context: NodeContext: rhetorical question - he doesn't want to be a god

253.speaker: Player
253.text: Wear it, and become a god?
253.context: NodeContext: rhetorical question - he doesn't want to be a god

188.speaker: Gale
188.text: And what kind of god would I be?
188.context: NodeContext: rhetorical question - he doesn't want to be a god

199.text: No kind the world will suffer for the absence of. And, I hope, there are plenty on mortal soil who would regret my absence.
199.context: NodeContext: Glad to relinquish this particular ambition (godhood), and appreciating the bonds he's made on the journey

242.speaker: Gale
242.text: No kind the world will suffer for the absence of. And, I hope, there are plenty on mortal soil who would regret my absence.
242.context: NodeContext: Glad to relinquish this particular ambition (godhood), and appreciating the bonds he's made on the journey

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Perhaps it's best you leave it where it is. Lest anyone should ever again be tempted by such power.

367.speaker: Gale
367.text: I fell to hubris once before and landed myself with this orb. I think I'd rather not make the same mistake again.
367.context: NodeContext: his resolve is beginning to form

11.speaker: Gale
11.text: With the Crown in my hands, I would be unstoppable.
11.context: NodeContext: excited by the prospect of power

246.speaker: Gale
246.text: And once I have, I'll take it to Mystra.
246.context: NodeContext: feeling his way to a decision

8.speaker: Gale
8.text: If I salvage the stones, I could retrieve it.
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale turns back to face party. NodeContext: subtly excited

233.speaker: Gale
233.text: Perhaps that's the best place for it. Away from the meddling of mortals and Mystra alike.
233.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale turns back to face party. NodeContext: accepting, at peace

285.speaker: Gale
285.text: It's not exactly the outcome Elminster hoped I would achieve, but it's the best I could do with the time his charm bought for me.
285.context: NodeContext: justifying his peace out loud

13.speaker: Gale
13.text: I feel the faintest pricklings of hunger from the orb already. It will not remain under the sway of his spell forever.
13.context: NodeContext: he knows his time on this earth might be limited, but isn't sad about it - just pondering what it means

306.speaker: Player
306.text: Who needs forever? Keep it fed and you've plenty of adventures still ahead of you.

273.speaker: Gale
273.text: Ahead of us, I hope. I've a feeling we've many more adventures to come.

258.speaker: Gale
258.text: But it's a journey I'd rather set out on with a good meal and a rest to my name. And a nightcap wouldn't go amiss.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: You should seek out Elminster. He might have a more permanent cure.
33.context:
NodeContext: the thought had crossed his mind perhaps but it's good to hear it affirmed by you
latter part is a joke about himself

98.text: A sound idea. It shouldn't take long to find him either - a wizard who cannot refrain from imparting his wisdom to the world... well, you know yourself how easy it is to find one of those.
98.context:
NodeContext: the thought had crossed his mind perhaps but it's good to hear it affirmed by you
latter part is a joke about himself

333.speaker: Gale
333.text: A sound idea. It shouldn't take long to find him either - a wizard who cannot refrain from imparting his wisdom to the world... well, you know yourself how easy it is to find one of those.
333.context:
NodeContext: the thought had crossed his mind perhaps but it's good to hear it affirmed by you
latter part is a joke about himself

304.speaker: Player
304.text: You'll tell me if you're about to blow, won't you?

70.text: Fear not - the orb is quite safe for the time being. I've a window in which to consider my options.

255.speaker: Gale
255.text: Fear not - the orb is quite safe for the time being. I've a window in which to consider my options.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Then we should make tonight count. After that, I fear you'll be too dangerous to stay with me.
73.context: NodeContext: trying to do the right thing - Hugh Grant style

104.speaker: Gale
104.text: If you'd prefer me to follow my own course from here, I understand. I've no desire to put you, or what's left of this city at risk.
104.context: NodeContext: trying to do the right thing - Hugh Grant style

76.speaker: Player
76.text: You're content to leave the Crown where it lies? I'd have thought you'd want to claim it?

150.speaker: Gale
150.text: If there's one thing I've taken from this adventure of ours, it's that some things are best left well alone. That Crown being one of them.

65.speaker: Gale
65.text: Such a force of destruction deserves to rust in a watery grave. And I've no intention of diving down to salvage it.

217.speaker: Gale
217.text: No, all I want now is a meal, a rest, and perhaps a nightcap to round it all off.

256.speaker: Astarion
256.text: Gale, are you brooding? Because I swear, if you ruin my good mood...
256.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] in a good mood, wondering why Gale isn't

139.speaker: Astarion
139.text: Gale, please. This is not the time to be morosely lost in thought.
139.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] in a good mood, wondering why Gale isn't

328.speaker: Wyll
328.context: NodeContext: in a good mood, wondering why Gale isn't

290.speaker: Jaheira
290.text: What is it, wizard? There will be plenty to furrow our brows over in the morning - why not take a break?
290.context: NodeContext: in a good mood, wondering why Gale isn't

206.speaker: Minsc
206.text: Why do you furrow your brow so, wizard? Boo says your abominable bat-cat has probably survived.
206.context: NodeContext: 'Abominable bat-cat' = Tara, Gale's tressym. Minsc still does not fully trust her, but is trying to comfort Gale all the same

3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
3.text: Wizard - was your brain entirely liquified during the battle? The fight is over, it's time to move on.

170.text: I can see the cogs moving behind your eyes, Gale. What's on your mind?
170.context: NodeContext: in a good mood, wondering why Gale isn't

124.speaker: Shadowheart
124.text: I can see the cogs moving behind your eyes, Gale. What's on your mind?
124.context: NodeContext: in a good mood, wondering why Gale isn't

67.speaker: Halsin
67.text: Gale? You seem distracted - does something trouble you?
67.context: NodeContext: in a good mood, wondering why Gale isn't

243.speaker: Player
243.text: You will survive, but you will be ready to take your life if you feel the slightest loss of control.
243.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Trust that everything will be fine. How could it not be?
42.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

135.speaker: Narrator
135.text: *You have thwarted the illithid Grand Design. You have honoured your people, you have secured their future. Your duty is fulfilled.*

205.speaker: Narrator
205.text: *You have thwarted the illithid Grand Design. You have defeated three Chosen and a Netherbrain. You are miraculous, and you have earned the right to live.*

16.speaker: Player
16.text: There should be no mind flayer roaming freely, not even you. Put yourself in prison.
16.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

202.speaker: Player
202.text: A ghaik with a conscience... remarkable. I would not have wished for such a fate for you, but perhaps it is for the best.
202.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

168.speaker: Lae'zel
168.text: A ghaik with a conscience... remarkable. I would not have wished for such a fate for you, but perhaps it is for the best.
168.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

362.speaker: Narrator
362.text: *It will not be without sadness that you depart your friends, but at least they will be safe.*

375.speaker: Narrator
375.text: *Perhaps there will be rats or other thoughtful vermin that you might sustain yourself on. Or, if you're lucky, a cellmate.*

194.speaker: Narrator
194.text: *That is, all but one of them.*

271.speaker: Shadowheart
271.text: I can't say I'm not a little thankful. You've been lucid for quite some time now, and from what I understand, you won't stay that way for long.
271.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

119.speaker: Wyll
119.text: Such nobility and self-sacrifice. I thought a mind flayer might have a stronger sense of self-preservation than that, but... well - goodbye.
119.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

287.speaker: Astarion
287.text: Such nobility and self-sacrifice. I thought a mind flayer might have a stronger sense of self-preservation than that, but... well - goodbye.
287.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

86.speaker: Astarion
86.text: As long as you're not expecting anyone to follow you... I wish you all the best. Though I have a feeling you'll be just fine.
86.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

195.speaker: Wyll
195.text: You already made the greatest sacrifice for us. I cannot believe you are ready to make another, but I thank you for it.
195.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

368.speaker: Gale
368.text: If you think iron bars will be enough to contain you, I fear you'll be in for a rather nasty shock. It's your mind that is your greatest asset, always has been. That's the one I'd watch.
368.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

9.speaker: Halsin
9.text: I cannot imagine the strength it must take to deny yourself access to the world. Your benevolence truly knows no bounds.
9.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

183.speaker: Jaheira
183.text: Yet another noble sacrifice. If I didn't know you better, I would think you were just showing off.
183.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

363.speaker: Minsc
363.text: Do not be sad, mind flayer. Even out of sight, Boo will remember you. And I will make sure he reminds me to remember you also.
363.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

307.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
307.text: Only cowards submit to slavery or imprisonment willingly. If you do not trust your own mind, you should have the courage to destroy yourself.
307.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

335.speaker: Player
335.text: The risk to others is too great. Take your own life.

39.speaker: Narrator
39.text: *You are a mind flayer, the very thing you sought to eradicate. Whatever self you still possess is quickly ebbing away.*
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: If you can fake a reflection by flipping the player upsidedown under the water, this would be a good place to do it.

126.text: *All living things that possess a mind are yours to manipulate, to consume. Even as you think the thought, you feel hungry.*
126.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

186.speaker: Narrator
186.text: *All living things that possess a mind are yours to manipulate, to consume. Even as you think the thought, you feel hungry.*
186.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

293.text: *Soon you will not be able to trust yourself at all. You will be a monstrosity beyond redemption.*
293.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

224.speaker: Narrator
224.text: *Soon you will not be able to trust yourself at all. You will be a monstrosity beyond redemption.*
224.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

275.speaker: Narrator
275.text: *And what of the orb? Will you still be able to control when it explodes when you can barely control yourself?*
275.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

121.speaker: Player
121.text: You're an illithid now - new worlds are yours to explore, for as long as you still live.

296.text: *You could start with Oryndoll, and perhaps later, Glyth itself. The world is yours to uncover, its stories yours to tell.*

249.speaker: Narrator
249.text: *You could start with Oryndoll, and perhaps later, Glyth itself. The world is yours to uncover, its stories yours to tell.*

59.speaker: Player
59.text: What does it matter? You're a mind flayer. This world is yours.

331.speaker: Player
331.text: The risk to others is too great. You will have to take your life. But somewhere far away from here.

239.speaker: Narrator
239.text: *Perhaps the Underdark. With your death, you might even eradicate others of your kind from the face of this realm.*

192.speaker: Narrator
192.text: *Or not. Perhaps you are unique among illithid-kind. Perhaps you will retain enough of who you are to resist your nature.*
192.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

93.speaker: Narrator
93.text: *A rogue mind flayer. Like the Emperor.*
93.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

281.speaker: Narrator
281.text: *The risk is certainly yours to take - will you?*
281.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

245.speaker: Player
245.text: You finally have a chance to live. Embrace it.
245.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

72.speaker: Player
72.text: You are a mind flayer now. You have never been so wise, nor strong, nor cool. Embrace it.
72.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

82.speaker: Player
82.text: You will survive, but you will be ready to take your life if you feel the slightest loss of control.
82.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

91.speaker: Narrator
91.text: *You have thwarted the illithid Grand Design. You have honoured your people, you have secured their future. Your duty is fulfilled.*
91.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

262.speaker: Narrator
262.text: Look at you. You're glorious. The greatest ally I could have wished for.
262.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

218.speaker: The Emperor
218.text: Look at you. You're glorious. The greatest ally I could have wished for.
218.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

376.text: *Your fate will be what you make of it. Now, you are your own master.*

365.speaker: Narrator
365.text: *Your fate will be what you make of it. Now, you are your own master.*

374.speaker: Player
374.text: Trust that everything will be fine. How could it not be?
374.context: NodeContext: Reacting with sadness to mind flayer player deciding to put themselves in prison

359.speaker: Player
359.text: There should be no mind flayer roaming freely, not even you. Put yourself in prison.
359.context: NodeContext: Reacting with sadness to mind flayer player deciding to put themselves in prison

21.text: I'm sorry you feel this is necessary... but I understand. You really are just like me.
21.context: NodeContext: Reacting with sadness to mind flayer player deciding to put themselves in prison

250.speaker: The Emperor
250.text: I'm sorry you feel this is necessary... but I understand. You really are just like me.
250.context: NodeContext: Reacting with sadness to mind flayer player deciding to put themselves in prison

80.speaker: Narrator
80.text: *It is not without sadness that you leave this world, but locked away, at least the people in it will be safe.*

234.speaker: Player
234.text: The risk to others is too great. Take your own life.

185.speaker: Player
185.text: You've been away too long and left too many books unread. Your library is calling.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: You've been away too long and left too many books unread. Your library is calling.

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *Not to mention a comfy armchair, a roaring fire, and a glass of fine wine.*

278.speaker: Narrator
278.text: *Waterdeep is waiting for you - it's time to go home.*

232.speaker: Player
232.text: Seek out Elminster's counsel - perhaps there's still a way to stabilise the orb for good.

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *No doubt the Old Mage will have much to say about your adventures, and you will have much to tell him. The only problem is - where to find him?*

60.speaker: Player
60.text: There are so many places you've yet to explore, and not much time left to see them. Better get started.

201.speaker: Narrator
201.text: *You've always been curious about Menzoberranzan - perhaps that would be a good place to start. And after that, Cormyr, or even the Feywild.*

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Someone should write of your adventures. What better biographer can there be than you?

167.speaker: Narrator
167.text: *You will be immortalised in legend - generations upon generations will celebrate the tale of Gale of Waterdeep - the wizard that defeated a Netherbrain.*

110.speaker: Narrator
110.text: *You could stay, and help. Your considerable strengths would not be unwelcome in such an endeavour...*
110.context: CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: If you can fake a reflection by flipping the player upsidedown under the water, this would be a good place to do it.

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *...Or you could find some other place to deploy them. Some other purpose, some other cause more befitting a mind flayer.*
75.context: InternalNodeContext: If recruited Karlach, go to: END_GameFinale_DeathOfKarlach. If not, go to: RomanceFates/SoloFates.
